units.title: Suppress mesoderm-derived immune cells in organoid culture
units.text: In our paradigm, the organoid culture method suppresses mesoderm-derived immune cell/microglia presence to achieve a more consistent forebrain identity and cell composition.
units.rationale: Describes a specific step to obtain a uniform forebrain organoid by removing immune cells.

units.title: Use adjacent organoid slices as control–treatment pairs
units.text: Sliced organoids provide an important advantage as two adjacent slices derived from the same organoid could serve as a control–treatment pair, increasing the confidence in analyzing drug-related effects.
units.rationale: Outlines a protocol for paired experimental design using organoid slices.

units.title: Add microglia/allogeneic immune cells to ALI-COs
units.text: supplementation of ALI-COs with microglia/allogeneic immune cells could address immune-related pathogenesis in ALS/FTD in the future.
units.rationale: Specifies a supplementation step to model immune interactions.

units.title: Perturbation experiments to dissect astrocyte pathology
units.text: Thus, teasing apart the primary and secondary astrocyte pathology and their functional consequences on neurons through perturbation experiments in C9 ALI-COs would be a therapeutically relevant goal.
units.rationale: Suggests experimental manipulation to study astrocyte effects.

units.title: Pharmacological rescue of protein homeostasis and DNA damage
units.text: The partial pharmacological rescue of early protein homeostasis- and DNA damage-related pathogenesis in our patient-specific DNAJC6 mutations.
units.rationale: Mentions a rescue intervention targeting specific cellular stress pathways.

units.title: Slice organoids to reduce necrotic core
units.text: Sliced organoids may improve nutrition, suppressing the necrotic core that often features in whole organoids.
units.rationale: Provides a method to improve organoid viability by slicing.
